pr_title: PassiveScanData add unit tests & active scan status code fallbacks

timeline.bodyText: I tried to do a similar test for getUsers but couldn't get it sorted out. psd can be mocked since it's final, and trying to do given//willReturn on an instantiated one will returned an empty list despite trying to give it a list to return.
timeline.author: kingthorin

replies.bodyText: Add a class variable for the extension and allow to set it, it can then be mocked to return what's needed.
replies.author: thc202

PassiveScanData add unit tests & active scan status code fallbacks

- Clarify/tweak handling of Custom Page checks for active scanning.
Fallback to using status codes if there isn't a context in play.
- Add UnitTests for PassiveScanData and status code fallback for passive
scan handling.

Signed-off-by: kingthorin <kingthorin@users.noreply.github.com>

scan handling.

PassiveScanData add unit tests & active scan status code fallbacks

- Clarify/tweak handling of Custom Page checks for active scanning.
Fallback to using status codes if there isn't a context in play.
- Add UnitTests for PassiveScanData and status code fallback for passive
scan handling.
- Re-implement
`HttpStatusCode.isClientError`/`HttpStatusCode.isServerError` to take
advantage of Custom Pages and Analyser as applicable for both ascan and
pscan.

PassiveScanData add unit tests & active scan status code fallbacks

- Clarify/tweak handling of Custom Page checks for active scanning.
Fallback to using status codes if there isn't a context in play.
- Add UnitTests for PassiveScanData and status code fallback for passive

Signed-off-by: kingthorin <kingthorin@users.noreply.github.com>

PassiveScanData add unit tests & active scan status code fallbacks

- Clarify/tweak handling of Custom Page checks for active scanning.
Fallback to using status codes if there isn't a context in play.
- Add UnitTests for PassiveScanData and status code fallback for passive
scan handling.
- Re-implement
`HttpStatusCode.isClientError`/`HttpStatusCode.isServerError` to take
advantage of Custom Pages and Analyser as applicable for both ascan and
pscan.
- For `isPage404`/`isPage500`/`isClientError`/`isServerError` check
`CustomPage.Type.OK_200` first. In `isPage200 check
`CustomPage.Type.ERROR_500` or `CustomPage.Type.NOTFOUND_404` first
(both ascan and pscan, in case the user is trying to override
something).

Signed-off-by: kingthorin <kingthorin@users.noreply.github.com>

timeline.author: ricekot

timeline.message:
PassiveScanData add unit tests & active scan status code fallbacks

- Clarify/tweak handling of Custom Page checks for active scanning.
Fallback to using status codes if there isn't a context in play.
- Add UnitTests for PassiveScanData and status code fallback for passive
scan handling.
- Re-implement
`HttpStatusCode.isClientError`/`HttpStatusCode.isServerError` to take
advantage of Custom Pages and Analyser as applicable for both ascan and
pscan.
- For `isPage404`/`isPage500`/`isClientError`/`isServerError` check
`CustomPage.Type.OK_200` first. In `isPage200` check
`CustomPage.Type.ERROR_500` or `CustomPage.Type.NOTFOUND_404` first
(both ascan and pscan, in case the user is trying to override
something).
- Fix "Cusotm" > "Custom" typos in PassiveScanData and AbstractPlugin.

Signed-off-by: kingthorin <kingthorin@users.noreply.github.com>

timeline.author: thc202
thc202
thc202
thc202
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -202,4 +242,34 @@ public boolean isPage404(HttpMessage msg) {
     public boolean isPageOther(HttpMessage msg) {
         return isCustomPage(msg, CustomPage.Type.OTHER);
     }
+
+    /**
+     * Tells whether or not the response has a status code between 400 and 499 (inclusive). Falls
+     * back to check {@code CustomPage.Type.NOTFOUND_404}. Checks if the message matches {@code
+     * CustomPage.Type.OK_200} first, in case the user is trying to override something.
+     *
+     * @param msg the message that will be checked
+     * @return {@code true} if the message matches, {@code false} otherwise
+     * @since TODO Add version
+     */
+    public boolean isClientError(HttpMessage msg) {
+        return isPage404(msg)
+                ? true
+                : HttpStatusCode.isClientError(msg.getResponseHeader().getStatusCode());
+    }
+
+    /**
+     * Tells whether or not the response has a status code between 500 and 599 (inclusive). Falls
+     * back to check {@code CustomPage.Type.EROOR_500}. Checks if the message matches {@code
+     * CustomPage.Type.OK_200} first, in case the user is trying to override something.

timeline.bodyText: Should have one for 404 too? (Same for other tests with corresponding type.)
timeline.author: thc202
thc202

timeline.bodyText: Change to false? (Or not set it?)
timeline.author: thc202

timeline.bodyText: This would have to be inlined? isPage404 might return false if page 200 match, so we should not be checking the status code in that case?
timeline.author: thc202
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -650,6 +674,38 @@ protected boolean isPageOther(HttpMessage msg) {
         return isCustomPage(msg, CustomPage.Type.OTHER);
     }
 
+    /**
+     * Tells whether or not the response has a status code between 400 and 499 (inclusive). Falls
+     * back to check {@code CustomPage.Type.NOTFOUND_404}. Checks if the message matches {@code
+     * CustomPage.Type.OK_200} or {@code CustomPage.Type.ERROR_500} first, in case the user is
+     * trying to override something.
+     *
+     * @param msg the message that will be checked
+     * @return {@code true} if the message matches, {@code false} otherwise
+     * @since TODO Add version
+     */
+    public boolean isClientError(HttpMessage msg) {
+        return isPage404(msg)

replies.author: kingthorin

timeline.author: thc202
thc202

timeline.bodyText: It would be better to setup the behaviour for 200/500 rather than setting it lenient.
timeline.author: thc202
thc202

replies.bodyText: I tried to get this working but couldn't sort out the mocks/spy'ing and the fact that mocked classes can't be final.
replies.author: kingthorin

replies.bodyText: There shouldn't be any final class involved, one can cover these with e.g.: given(context.isCustomPageWithFallback(msg, CustomPage.Type.NOTFOUND_404)).willReturn(true);
replies.author: thc202

timeline.author: thc202
thc202
thc202

timeline.message:
PassiveScanData add unit tests & active scan status code fallbacks

- Clarify/tweak handling of Custom Page checks for active scanning.
Fallback to using status codes if there isn't a context in play.
- Add UnitTests for PassiveScanData and status code fallback for passive
scan handling.
- Re-implement
`HttpStatusCode.isClientError`/`HttpStatusCode.isServerError` to take
advantage of Custom Pages and Analyser as applicable for both ascan and
pscan.
- For `isPage404`/`isPage500`/`isClientError`/`isServerError` check
`CustomPage.Type.OK_200` first. In `isPage200` check
`CustomPage.Type.ERROR_500` or `CustomPage.Type.NOTFOUND_404` first
(both ascan and pscan, in case the user is trying to override
something).
- Fix "Cusotm" > "Custom" typos in PassiveScanData and AbstractPlugin.

Signed-off-by: kingthorin <kingthorin@users.noreply.github.com>

- Re-implement

pscan.
- For `isPage404`/`isPage500`/`isClientError`/`isServerError` check

`CustomPage.Type.ERROR_500` or `CustomPage.Type.NOTFOUND_404` first
(both ascan and pscan, in case the user is trying to override
something).
- Fix "Cusotm" > "Custom" typos in PassiveScanData and AbstractPlugin.

Signed-off-by: kingthorin <kingthorin@users.noreply.github.com>
